page.title: 07E. Kilbride Public Transport
page.content: The Town Centre is serviced by many bus services for both local and more distant destinations. There is also a very busy taxi-rank which many of the laden shoppers use. Within half a mile of the Town Centre is the railway station but here the picture is not quite so bright. The railway pre-dates the New Town and for much of the way to Glasgow is single track. This means there is a far less frequent service than one might expect in a town of a comparable size, with a further draw- back that, although the station may have been ideally situated for the old village, it is some distance from the residential areas erected since the New Town development. Another factor worth mentioning at this point is the higher than average incidence of car ownership in the area which again does not help the rail travel problem.
